meanings.definition: An act or instance of lying in wait to attack by surprise.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up an ambushes to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The ambushes in the forest caught the travelers off guard.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox planned an ambushes to catch the rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The ambushes of questions from the teacher left the students speechless.
meanings.sent5: The ambushes of compliments made her blush with happiness.

meanings.definition: To attack from a concealed position.
meanings.sent1: The bandits ambushes the unsuspecting travelers on the road.
meanings.sent2: The sniper ambushes the enemy troops from a hidden spot.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat likes to ambushes the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain ambushes the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent5: The ninja ambushes the enemy with swift and silent moves.

meanings.definition: To lie in wait for an enemy.
meanings.sent1: The hunter ambushes near the watering hole for the deer.
meanings.sent2: The spy ambushes in the shadows, waiting for the signal.
meanings.sent3: The siblings like to ambushes each other during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The idea ambushes his mind when he least expects it.
meanings.sent5: The fog ambushes the city, hiding everything from view.
